ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Jebb Metals have now put to work their new Koloss 1000 TS. This Lefort shear/baler is proving to be a real head turner as it sits proudly at the top of their yard. 

ğŸ’¥ Delivered to site in three main pieces the machine is assembled on a foundation frame and commissioned within two weeks. The machine is very productive on all grades of ferrous and non-ferrous metals, shearing with the 1000T window crosshead or baling with the 180T baling ram. 

ğŸ’ªğŸ½ The power, strength and speed of its cutting is giving very pleasing results for its new owners. This machine, fitted with the 600HP Scania diesel engine, operators control cabin and tunnel pusher ram is easily capable of 25-30 Tonnes per hour of production, depending upon material and cut length. 

We wish Philip & Stephen all the best for the future with their new Lefort Koloss 1000 TS ğŸ™Œ

ğŸ’¥ğŸ¬ [ğ¯ğ¢ğğğ¨] BORNES RECYCLAGE ramps-up with a new Lidex 1300T !

Â«Â Our Lidex can go up to 70t/hr. It has a rail breaker and can handle heavy scrap when needed. In the crane, thanks to the automatic cycle, our operator can prepare the next load while the scrap previously loaded is still being processed. No time is lost !Â Â» Charles Bornes 

M. Bornes also prizes the total cooperation shown throughout the project including the recommendations for the most efficient layout of the machine on site, the supply of the civil engineering guide drawings, the logistic operations, the assembly & commissioning of the machine, not forgetting the training of operators and technicians.

ğŸ¤ Thanks again to the Bornes family for their trust.
Wich one would you choose ? 650, 700, 800 or 1000T ? ğŸ¤©Wich one would you choose ? 650, 700, 800 or 1000T ? ğŸ¤©

Fact Friday: "Patented Innovation" ğŸ§

Check out our LEFORTÂ® TRAX 650 cutting heavy scrap metal with ease.
The LEFORTÂ® TRAX self-propelled shear/baler, a patented innovation, is designed for unrivaled on-site mobility. With just a single switch on the radio control, the operator can move the entire machine towards the scrap metal pile, eliminating the need to transport scrap to the machineâ€”boosting efficiency and productivity.

LEFORTÂ® TRAX Specifications:
âœ… Cutting force: 600-1250T
âœ… Hold down force: 120-180T
âœ… Box closing force: 2 x 240-350T
âœ… Pusher ram force: 180T
âœ… Cutting width: 800-940 mm
âœ… Box length: 6000-7000 mm
âœ… Power: Diesel or electric options available

This week, I had the opportunity to be involved in the commissioning of the LEFORTÂ® TRAX, a cutting-edge machine from one of the worldâ€™s leading manufacturers in heavy-duty metal recycling. â™»ï¸ 

This one-of-a-kind machine combines powerful baling and shearing capabilities, making heavy duty scrap processing effortless. What sets it apart is its self-propelled mobilityâ€”mounted on tracks and operated with a single remote, it offers unmatched flexibility and efficiency on-site.

Thank you Walter Leijen, our director for this amazing opportunity. Looking forward for upcoming projects!

Below is a picture of me with the Lefort Trax 650.This week, I had the opportunity to be involved in the commissioning of the LEFORTÂ® TRAX, a cutting-edge machine from one of the worldâ€™s leading manufacturers in heavy-duty metal recycling. â™»ï¸ 

This one-of-a-kind machine combines powerful baling and shearing capabilities, making heavy duty scrap processing effortless. What sets it apart is its self-propelled mobilityâ€”mounted on tracks and operated with a single remote, it offers unmatched flexibility and efficiency on-site.

Thank you Walter Leijen, our director for this amazing opportunity. Looking forward for upcoming projects!

Below is a picture of me with the Lefort Trax 650.

We recently delivered a 700-ton TRAX shear to William Waugh (Edinburgh) Limited. The arrival of this new shear/baler confirms the companyâ€™s commitment for staying at the forefront of technical progress.

The decision to acquire a 700-ton TRAX shear was driven by the need to modernize equipment and meet growing production demands. Alan Waugh  expressed his admiration for the flexibility of the TRAX, movable anywhere on the scrap yard.

With a cutting force of 700 tons and 6.6 m compression box, it is capable of processing large volumes of ferrous and non-ferrous. Each 325-ton press lid, along with a 180-ton pusher, ensures optimal material compression.

This shear is equipped with a 400 HP diesel engine allowing to process up to 20 t/hr and produce over 30 bales/hr.

The acquisition of this new TRAX machine marks a turning point for the company, which combines its family tradition with technological innovations to meet the future challenges of scrap metal recycling.We recently delivered a 700-ton TRAX shear to William Waugh (Edinburgh) Limited. This shear is equipped with a 400 HP diesel engine allowing to process up to 20 t/hr and produce over 30 bales/hr.
